system_boundaries.description: Defines the boundaries of components and systems directly controlled by the digital banking platform versus external systems it depends on.

definition_criteria.criterion1: INSIDE: Components directly under the control of the banking platform.
definition_criteria.criterion2: OUTSIDE: External systems that the platform depends on but does not control.
definition_criteria.criterion3: INTERFACES: Connection points between internal and external systems.

assumptions.key: This server is fully managed and secured by the bank.

constraints.key: Must meet PCI-DSS and GDPR compliance requirements.

assumptions.key: Database is encrypted at rest and in transit.

constraints.key: Must support high availability and disaster recovery.

assumptions.key: Engine handles both internal and external transactions securely.

constraints.key: Must process transactions within SLA-defined time limits.

assumptions.key: Devices are not controlled by the bank but must meet minimum OS version requirements.

constraints.key: Requires secure communication via TLS.

assumptions.key: SWIFT network is available and functional for international payments.

constraints.key: Compliance with SWIFT security standards is required.

assumptions.key: API is available for real-time credit score retrieval.

constraints.key: Requires secured API keys and encrypted communication.

assumptions.key: API endpoints are protected by OAuth2.

constraints.key: API requests must comply with rate limits.

assumptions.key: Secure file transfer protocol ensures data integrity.

constraints.key: Only authorized users can access SFTP server.

assumptions.key: Identity provider is reliable and up-to-date.

constraints.key: Integration must support multi-factor authentication.

system_boundaries.description: Identifies points where trust transitions between components, systems, and actors.

definition_criteria.criterion1: Trust transitions where data moves between trusted and untrusted zones.
definition_criteria.criterion2: Trust boundaries where authentication or encryption is required.

elements.element_name: Between mobile app and API gateway

assumptions.key: Mobile app users authenticate via OAuth2.

constraints.key: All communication must use TLS for encryption.

elements.element_name: Between application server and payment processor

assumptions.key: Payment processor enforces its own security policies.

constraints.key: API keys and encryption are required for communication.

assumptions.key: Backup storage is encrypted and access-controlled.

constraints.key: Data must be encrypted during transfer and at rest.

system_boundaries.description: Defines areas of responsibility between the platform, external entities, and shared responsibilities.

definition_criteria.criterion1: Identify components or data fully owned by the platform.
definition_criteria.criterion2: Identify components or data responsibility of external entities.

assumptions.key: Integrity is ensured by platform controls.

constraints.key: Data must remain accurate and consistent.

assumptions.key: Customers are responsible for securing their devices.

constraints.key: Bank can require minimum security standards for app usage.

assumptions.key: Bank works with payment processors to resolve disputes.

constraints.key: Resolution adheres to regulatory requirements.

system_boundaries.description: Highlights transitions of critical data between systems, stakeholders, and regulatory authorities.

definition_criteria.criterion1: Identify flows of sensitive data between systems.
definition_criteria.criterion2: Highlight compliance requirements for data transitions.

elements.element_name: Customer PII moves from our database to credit bureau

assumptions.key: PII is encrypted during transfer.

constraints.key: Transfer must comply with GDPR.

elements.element_name: Transaction data shared with regulatory authority

assumptions.key: Sensitive data is anonymized where possible.

constraints.key: Transfer must comply with AML/BSA regulations.

elements.element_name: Account data replicated to disaster recovery site

assumptions.key: Replication occurs in near real-time.

constraints.key: Data must be encrypted at rest and in transit.
